subject: Perl and OpenAI
header: I am not qualified to give my opinion on OpenAPI. I have noticed Curtis has an opinion and widely respected too. If you haven't read then I would highly recommend you please do, e.g. Will You Loose Your Job to AI?, Claude Sonnet 3.5 beats ChatGPT 4.0 and Building an iPhone App with ChatGPT.

How about Perl dealing with the OpenAI? We have another post, An OpenAI Chatbot in Perl, where you will find the detailed discussion on how you can use the core OOP with OpenAI. Talking about Corrina, we are aware the progress is slow and steady. Having said, there is still plenty of work needed to be done. There is a dicussion on How you can help get Corinna in the core faster? on reddit. Feel free to share your views and if possible offer your help to speed up the work.
With the recent release of Perl v5.40, you can find out the details of core ehancements in Perl v5.40.0 Shows That It Is Too Resilient To Die and What's New in Perl v5.40?.
Dave Cross released a new CPAN module App::MergeCal and shared his story behind it in the post: Combining calendars.
Enjoy rest of the newsletter and please look after yourself.

entries.title: An OpenAI Chatbot in Perl
entries.author: curtis_ovid_poe
entries.text: Find out how to use the latest core OOP syntax to create OpenAPI Chatbot.

entries.title: Combining calendars
entries.author: dave_cross
entries.text: Get to know the story behind the CPAN module: App::Mergecal.

entries.title: Perl v5.40.0 Shows That It Is Too Resilient To Die
entries.author: nikos_vaggalis
entries.text: If you missed the latest release Perl v5.40 then you must checkout this to find out more about the core enhancements in the latest release.

entries.title: New Standards of Conduct published
entries.author: ruth_bavousett
entries.text: TPRF has created a new Standard of Conduct to help combat bullying, harassment and abuse in our communities.

chapters.title: The Weekly Challenge
chapters.header: The Weekly Challenge by Mohammad Sajid Anwar will help you step out of your comfort-zone. You can even win prize money of $50 by participating in the weekly challenge. We pick one champion at the end of the month from among all of the contributors during the month, thanks to the sponsor Lance Wicks.

entries.author: mohammad_anwar
entries.text: Welcome to a new week with a couple of fun tasks "Count Common" and "Strong Pair". If you are new to the weekly challenge then why not join us and have fun every week. For more information, please read the FAQ.
entries.title: The Weekly Challenge - 277

entries.author: mohammad_anwar
entries.text: Enjoy a quick recap of last week's contributions by Team PWC dealing with the "Complete Day" and "Maximum Frequency" tasks in Perl and Raku. You will find plenty of solutions to keep you busy.

chapters.title: Perl Tutorial
chapters.header: A section for newbies and for people who need some refreshing of their Perl knowledge. If you have questions or suggestions about the articles, let me know and I'll try to make the necessary changes. The included articles are from the Perl Maven Tutorial and are part of the Perl Maven eBook.
